page.title: 16CHALFONT ST GILES TODAY
page.content: The village of Chalfont St Giles lies just off the main Chalfonts-Amersham road.Much of the old village is still preserved,including the church,the village green with its pond and the old village pump,and many old houses.The river Misbourne flows beneath the vill- age.There are over 30 shops and the village has been extended to include many new roads and housing estates, private and council.After some con- troversy,a new Medical Centre to serve the much increased population,has been built on Green Belt land behind the church to replace the inadequate pre- mises on the green.A series of lamp standards erected by the County Council following a number of accidents on the Seer Green road are considered so ugly that the local Council refuses to have them lit.The village was the location of the TV series and film "Dad's Army".
